meanings.definition: Having or consisting of thin, flat plates or layers.
meanings.sent1: The mushroom had a lamelliform cap that looked like a stack of tiny plates.
meanings.sent2: The lamelliform leaves of the fern provided a delicate covering on the forest floor.
meanings.sent3: The lamelliform design of the cake made it look like a delicious layered treat.
meanings.sent4: Her lamelliform hair cascaded down her back like a waterfall of thin sheets.
meanings.sent5: The lamelliform clouds in the sky resembled a series of flat, overlapping shapes.

meanings.definition: Resembling a thin, flat plate or layer.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a lamelliform sculpture that mimicked the appearance of a flat plate.
meanings.sent2: The lamelliform structure of the building gave it a sleek and modern look.
meanings.sent3: The lamelliform shadows cast by the trees created a unique pattern on the ground.
meanings.sent4: Her lamelliform dress flowed around her like a smooth, flat sheet of fabric.
meanings.sent5: The lamelliform pattern on the butterfly's wings made it blend perfectly with the tree bark.
